params.text:
Social Exchanges

Take Part in a Simple Conversation 1:

Language in Action

• Start the Conversation – Small Talk
  • Questions/ Talk about Origins
  • Ask/ Talk about the Family

Ready to chat with others in English? This module will give you the tools to have a simple conversation!

Here's what you'll learn:

1. Small Talk: Master how to talk about the weather, hobbies, and other everyday topics.

  2. Ask and talk about origins: Become confident in asking where someone is from and talking about your own background.

  3. Ask and talk about family: Learn how to ask about someone's family and introduce your own family members.
Which are good subjects for small talk? Which are bad? Please sort these subjects into the correct categories:
Small Talk: A Little Conversation Starter

Small talk is a casual conversation about everyday things. It's a way to be friendly and break the ice with someone you don't know well, or with someone you know in a different setting (like a colleague at a work event).

params.textField:
Alison: Hi Jemima! How are you *doing* today?
Jemima: Hi, I'm doing well, thanks! A bit busy this morning, but that's okay. How *about* you?
Alison: No *problem* at all, busy mornings are normal! I'm good thanks, just enjoying this lovely *weather*, isn't it?
Jemima: Absolutely! Such a nice change from all the rain we had last week. What are you planning to do this *weekend* to enjoy the sunshine?

dialogs.answer: This is a simple way to ask someone about their nationality or country of origin.
This is a good way to ask someone if they moved from another place to live where they are now.
This is a casual way to ask someone if they live in the local area.
This is a simple way to state your nationality.

dialogs.text: I was originally from [Your Country], but now I live in [Current Country].
dialogs.answer: This is a way to say you moved from another place.
This is a way to say where you live locally.

metadata.title: talk about origins drag the words

params.text: Please listen to the conversation between Ben and Tarik talking about where they are from, and answer the questions below:

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: Where is Tarik originally from?
Question 2 of 3: Where does Ben currently live?
Question 3 of 3: Why did Tarik move to London?
answers:
Because of the many opportunities there

He's a huge Arsenal fan

He loves the rain

l10n.a11yShowSolution: Show the solution. The task will be marked with its correct solution.
l10n.a11yRetry: Retry the task. Reset all responses and start the task over again.

params.text:
Ben: Hi Tarik! How are you doing today?

Tarik: Hi Ben, I'm great, thanks! And you?

Ben: I'm doing well, thanks! Listen, where are you from originally?

Tarik: I am originally from Casablanca, Morocco. Beautiful city! But now I live in London.

Ben: Wow, cool! Why did you move to London?

Tarik: Well, I always wanted to experience a new city, and London has so many opportunities. What about you, Ben. Where are you from?

Ben: I'm originally from Los Angeles, and I still live there.

Tarik: Ah, Los Angeles! Land of sunshine and beaches, right?

Ben: Exactly! Although, we do get some rain sometimes too.

params.text: Click the flashcard to see useful phrases for talking about/asking about family:
Talk About The Family - Flashcards

dialogs.answer: A general question to see if someone has close relatives.
This is a question to ask someone if they have a spouse.
This is a question to ask someone if they have kids.

dialogs.text: How many siblings do you have?
dialogs.answer: This is a question to ask someone how many brothers and sisters they have.
This is a simple answer to say you have close relatives.
This answers the question about your marital status.
This answers the question about your kids

dialogs.text: I have one older brother and one younger sister.
dialogs.answer: This answers the question about your siblings.
This tells someone where your parents live.
This describes the size of your family.

metadata.title: talk about family drag the words

params.text: Please complete the following exercise to make useful sentences for talking about family:
Talk About Family - Listening & Quiz
Please listen to the opinions of Jemima and Tarik talking about family and answer the questions below:

Jemima: My family is quite big! I have two brothers and three sisters. We all live in different cities now, but we try to get together whenever we can. My parents live in Vancouver, Canada. It's a beautiful place!

Tarik: I'm married and we have two children, a boy and a girl. They keep me busy! I don't have any siblings myself, but my parents are still back in Casablanca. I miss them, but we call each other often.

choices.question: Question 1 of 4: How many siblings does Jemima have?
Question 2 of 4: Where do Tarik's parents live?
Question 3 of 4: Tarik says his children keep him busy. How many children does he have?

params.text: Choose the best answer to complete each question.

choices.question: Question 1 of 6: What is a good subject for a casual conversation?
answers:
Ask about the weather.

Ask about someone's salary.

Talk about politics.

Discuss your health problems.

choices.question: Question 3 of 6: How can you ask Jemima about her marital status?
answers:
Are you married? 

Do you have a family?

How many children do you have?

Tell her about your spouse.

choices.question: Question 4 of 6: What does "Do you live around here?" mean?
answers:
Do you live in the local area?

Do you like to travel?

Are you originally from here?

Do you live in the same country?

choices.question: Question 5 of 6: Which of the following is correct?
answers:
I'm from France

I‘m with China.

I'm at Germany.

I have Mexico.

choices.question: Question 6 of 6: What is an unsuitable topic for small talk?
answers:
Health problems

Hobbies and interests

Local events or news

Weekend plans
